Description: A bacterial disease that causes yellow or brown spots on leaves.
Why it occurred: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas albilineans.
Prevention measures: Plant resistant varieties and control the insect vector Holotrichia serrata.
Recommended steps to cure the disease: There is no cure for sugarcane bacterial blight. Infected plants should be removed and destroyed.

A fungal disease that causes red lesions on stems and leaves.
Why it occurred: Caused by the fungus Glomerella tucumanensis.
Prevention measures: Plant resistant varieties and avoid overwatering.
Recommended steps to cure the disease: Apply a fungicide such as propiconazole or triadimefon.

Description: A viral disease that causes red stripes on leaves.
Why it occurred: Caused by the sugarcane red stripe virus.
Prevention measures: Plant resistant varieties and control aphid vectors.
Recommended steps to cure the disease: There is no cure for sugarcane red stripe. Infected plants should be removed and destroyed.
